title: [K-12] Instructional Design Program for Pre-Service Teachers to Strengthen Disaster Response Competencies for Heavy Rainfall

context.prior_knowledge: Basic disaster management knowledge, understanding of educational methodologies, and fundamental concepts of meteorological phenomena
context.additional_context: Designed based on experiences developing disaster response education programs referencing Senju Elementary School in Nagaoka City, damaged by Typhoon Hagibis in 2019. Implements blended learning environments combining digital devices with offline practical training

learning_goals: Learners can explain and demonstrate at least three safety action procedures for protecting students during heavy rainfall.
Learners can analyze childrenâ€™s psychological responses in disaster situations and develop educational intervention strategies.
Learners can design disaster response education programs by applying the ADDIE model.
Learners can perform decision-making to optimize evacuation routes during heavy rainfall using virtual simulation tools.

resources: Disaster Response Training VR Simulation Software
Typhoon Damage Report for Case Analysis

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
